After delivering stillborn, woman \u2018.description: BAREILLY: A 26-year-old woman fell to death from third floor of a government women’s hospital under mysterious circumstances where she was admitted recently. The woman, a resident of Laharpur Balia village under Bhamora police station jurisdiction, had delivered a stillborn baby on June 9. Family of the deceased woman said that she was suffering from severe depression after learning about her stillborn baby. However, doctors are not ready to accept this theory and the matter has been referred to police for a probe. The incident took place at around 4:30 am. Dr Alka Sharma, chief medical superintendent (CMS) of government women’s hospital, said that it was a caesarean delivery and she was shocked to know how she could climb up to the third floor. “The woman was admitted to a maternity ward on the first floor which is completely covered from all sides. A woman who has undergone caesarean delivery cannot walk even for 10 steps without help from others, within a week of the surgery. It is indeed a matter of investigation now. The body has been handed over to the police for post-mortem examination,” the CMS said. The CMS also said that the hospital staff informed her about the incident at 4:51 am. Doctors said that since the woman was very upset after the delivery, they had allowed her husband and mother in-law to stay with her as attendants. While station house officer of Kotvali, Pankaj Tyagi, said that they would examine the CCTV footage to ascertain who was with the woman when she climbed the third floor. Notably, the woman was married only a year ago. Her mother in-law said, “My daughter in-law was suffering from severe depression after giving birth to a stillborn. She used to start crying after seeing other women with newborn babies in the maternity ward. I was sleeping when she went out of the ward and I immediately informed the ward boy as soon as I realised that she was missing.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shahjahanpur to tap gau shakti to make o.description: BAREILLY: In a bid to make use of stray cattle herded in cow shelters, Shahjahanpur administration has come up with an innovative plan to use their urine and dung to manufacture a range of organic products. It also hopes that once owners learn about their usefulness, they will not abandon their cattle, which left unattended become a menace for all. It is proposed to manufacture beauty products like organic gau-ubtan (face pack), bio pesticides, organic fertilizers, agarbatti (incense sticks), soap and cow dung cakes from cow urine and dung. . These products will be marketed under the name, ‘Gau-Shakti’, said government officials. The idea is to ensure that people identify the economic value of bovines even if they are not giving milk or ploughing the fields, they added. “Keeping a cow even if it is not giving milk is useful as the dung of a single animal in a year can produce bio-fertilizers and bio-pesticides for 30 acres of agricultural land,” said chief development officer Mahendra Singh Tanwar. Making an announcement to the effect, Amrit Tripathi, DM of Shahjahanpur, distributed gau-shakti kits to 313 couples who tied the knot at a mass wedding ceremony on Sunday. “These products are expected to see a proper launch within a month and may hit online stores soon. The revenue generated from these products will be used for running effectively cattle shelters here,” he added.. In order to implement the idea, district administration took the support of Sanjay Upadhyaya, a chemical engineer who has devoted his life for conservation of stray cattle. After conducting experiments with cow dung and urine, he has developed new products which can be used in day-to-day life like tooth powder, tooth paste and bio-fertilizers. Giving details about the project, Tripathi told TOI, “We are trying to come up with a brand of products made from cow dung and cow urine. These products will be known as Gau-Shakti. The products made from cow dung and urine already have has good demand in the market and it will help us to generate revenue, which can be used for running cow shelters. Also, several people will get employment if these projects prove to be a success.” CDO Tanwar said, “During the Vedic era, the cow was considered sacred and every produce of a cow was utilized. Very few people know that keeping a cow means ‘zero budgeting agriculture’ as fertilizers and organic pesticides can be prepared from the cow dung and its urine. If people become aware about such products derived from cow dung and urine, then they may stop abandoning their cattle.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Green Card.description: NEW DELHI: In an attempt to strike a balance between those standing in queue for decades for employment-based green cards (owing to the per country caps) and the need to protect American workers, a bill - 'The Fairness for High Skilled Immigrants Act (S.386)', has been recently amended by Republican Senator Mike Lee. The amendments are being seen as a bid to facilitate its passage. To provide more protection to American workers, it requires that the employer sponsoring H-1B workers must disclose online (for at least 30 days) various details of the job on offer, such as occupation or job position, education and experience requirements, location and also how to apply for this job. A filing fee is also sought to be introduced forLabour Condition Applications(LCA), which is an attestation-based requirement that has to be met by sponsoring employers prior to filing of H-1B visa applications. This bill was originally introduced in the US Senate on February 7. It sought to remove the per country cap on employment-based green cards and shorten the wait time for the vast majority of applications in the backlog. US issues 1.40 lakh employment-based green cards annually. Substantial increase in denial of H-1B petitions of Indians: ReportHowever, not more than 7% can go to nationals of any one country. With a high influx of the Indian diaspora in the US, it has resulted in a heavy backlog, with those in the EB-2 category (having advanced degrees) having to face a wait time of 151 years. "Over the last decade, various bills to remove this per country cap, have failed to become law. S. 386 has been rescued from the fate of its predecessors through appeasement, specifically, by agreeing to amendments that would allow further restrictions on merit-based non-immigrant visas, particularly with regards to the H-1B programme. However, it is interesting to note that many of these so-called 'new' restrictions already exist in one form or another," Florida based immigration attorney, Ashwin Sharma, told TOI. For instance, even currently,   H-1B sponsoring employers have to certify   that they are not favouring immigrant workers over American workers. They have to indicate how they calculated the prevailing wages they are offering to H-1B workers (but these records are to be made available only on specific request of the concerned authorities), explained Sharma. While the bill would alleviate the green card backlog and significantly benefit India, followed by China, it also seeks to ensure that the green card for others is not delayed beyond the time it would have otherwise taken, had this bill not been passed. Another similar bill HR 1044, introduced by the Democrats is pending in the US House. 'Immigration Voice', a US based non-profit which is engaged in alleviating problems faced by legal highly-skilled immigrants, in its social media post on June 17, said that it has reached a deal with Senator Lee and the amendments will enable the bill to pass. "We have a deal to break the deadlock in the Senate!," it posted on Twitter. A note, issued by it analysing the various facets of S.386 including the amendments, states that the bill allows investigations against H-1B frauds to be based on anonymous complaints, eliminates arbitrary deadlines on investigations and permits investigations for general non-compliance with LCA requirements, as opposed to simply for a wilful violation. It seeks to increase the penalties for LCA violations that have remained unchanged since 1990. Whistle-blower protection, which is already available, is also incorporated in the amendment. The fee proposed for LCA documentation will be used to fund the department of labour's (DOL's) administrative and investigative activities associated with H-1B programme. A few amendments in the bill, such as the 30 day internet posting requirement, could cause delays and challenges, states an immigration expert. Another counsel says: "Companies can depute their employees on a B-1 (business) visa to the US for a temporary period. The requirement was that the salary should be borne by the non-US employer. While a B-1 was getting tougher to obtain, it was an option available. The bill seeks to eliminate the 'B-1 in lieu of H-1B' option. We need to see how this will pan out." Rare red-headed vulture spotted in Dudhw.description: BAREILLY: The summer bird census at Dudhwa has revealed the presence of several rare birds in the reserve. In the census held between June 3 and 7, the surveyors found the presence of birds like a Red-Headed vulture and Black-Crusted bulbul. In all, 160 species of birds were found in the reserve during the four-day survey. The survey was conducted jointly by UP forest department, WWF-India, Katarniaghat Foundation, Rohilkhand Nature Club and Cluster Innovation Centre of Delhi University. Asani Bhaduri, an assistant professor of Cluster Innovation Centre, who was part of the survey team, said it exceeded his expectations when the Red-Headed vulture was sighted in Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary. It was alone and sitting on the top branch of a tall tree. This species of vulture is listed as critically endangered in the 2007 IUCN Red List. According to a recent assessment by the International Union for Conservation of Nature, only between 2,500 to 9,999 mature individual birds of this species are believed to be existing today. Apart from the Red-Headed vulture, wildlife experts were overjoyed on sighting the Swamp Francolin, Black-Crested bulbul, Grey-Headed Fish eagle, Blue-Bearded bee-eater, Purple heron and Eurasian Goshawk. Deputy director of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve Mahaveer Kaujalgi told TOI, “The bird census was completed under the guidance of Ramesh Pandey, director of DTR. The sightings of birds were encouraging. The Red-Headed vulture was sighted in Kishanpur, which was a pleasant surprise for us. The Black-Crested Bulbul was sighted after a long time. This bird is mostly found in the Himalayan region and had disappeared from here for quite a long while.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Depressed after separation from wife, 35.description: BAREILLY: Sanjeev Singh, a 35-year-old resident of Meerapur under Fatehganj West police station limits, ended his life hanging from ceiling on Tuesday. According to police, Singh was depressed after his wife left his six months ago and started living with her parents. She refused to come back despite various requests from him, police said. The body has been sent for post-mortem and a probe is on. The couple, married a decade ago, separated six months ago. Police said that during investigation, they learnt from the deceased’s family that Singh had sold a portion of his land to give money to his wife that she had demanded. “His wife and her parents said that Singh had abandoned her and denied to keep her with him. They claimed that they requested them several times to sit and talk to resolve the matter, but Singh and his family were adamant. Now we are probing the matter from all angles. Any complaint from the family of the deceased man is yet to come,” SP (rural) Sansar Singh said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. History-sheeter, cop injured in encounte.description: BAREILLY: History-sheeter Sameer, alias, Shahroz, aka, Dulhe Miyan, wanted in several criminal cases in Sambhal district, was arrested after an encounter on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, while his accomplice managed to flee taking advantage of darkness. In the gun battle, Sameer and police constable Kuldeep Kumar sustained bullet injuries and were admitted to hospital, where doctors proclaimed them out of danger. An FIR has been registered. According to police, a team was on a routine checking near Gavan village around 10pm when they signalled two youths astride a motorbike coming from Anupshahr side to stop. However, instead of following police directions, they sped up towards Sambhal. The police team soon alerted Hayatnagar police station and cops encircled them near Shakurpur village. However, the criminal opened fire at police, and a bullet struck constable Kuldeep Kumar on his left arm. Superintendent of police Yamuna Prasad said, “Police team also returned fire in their defence and nabbed one accused, while the other disappeared in cane fields. Sameer, who is wanted in several cases lodged against him, including cow slaughter, sustained bullet injuries in his leg.” Police seized a country-made pistol, live cartridges and a motorbike from Sameer’s possession. An FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) of the Indian penal Code (IPC) and relevant sections of the Arms Act was lodged against Sameer and his absconding accomplice. Minor girl raped by 55-year-old in Pilib.description: PILIBHIT: A 55-year-old man, identified as Nikhil Nath, was arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl of his neighbourhood in a village under Gajraula police station. According to a written complaint filed by the minor’s father on Monday, the rape allegedly occurred at 5 pm on June 8, but the matter was referred to police by gram pradhan, Shridam Mistri, only at 9.30 pm on June 16. The police have sent the girl for medical examination and have lodged an FIR in the matter. SP Manoj Kumar Sonkar, ASP Rohit Mishra and CO of Pilibhit city circle Dharm Singh Marchhal inspected the area and wanted to know the reason behind the delay in lodging the FIR. The minor’s father informed the police that her daughter was playing outside the house on June 8 when he was at work and his wife went to meet someone in the neighbourhood. Taking advantage of their absence, the accused grabbed the little girl, dragged her inside the house and raped her. According to ASP Mishra, the minor’s father told him that his wife remained silent and did not disclose it even to him. It was only on Sunday evening that the minor’s mother narrated the heinous crime to her husband following which he, with support of the gram pradhan, informed the dial 100 police response vehicle and the matter was reported to the police in writing on Monday, the ASP said. Meanwhile, Tulsi, the wife of accused told media persons that her husband was asked by Mistri to pay Rs 3 lakh at a village panchayat for “settling the matter and giving relief to her husband from imprisonment”. SHO Birja Ram told TOI that an FIR has been lodged against Nikhil Nath under section 376 (rape) of IPC and sections 3 and 4 of POCSO act. The accused was arrested and sent to prison. The police will take further action in accordance with the medical examination report, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three persons murdered, two injured in S.description: BAREILLY: People of Shahjahanpur district woke up to multiple murders on Saturday morning. The murders took place in two different locations on Friday night. The first incident took place in Katra where a man and his young son were shot at by the man’s elder brother over a property dispute. The youth succumbed to his injuries while his father was admitted to a district hospital. The second incident was reported from Shahjahanpur city at around 9.30pm where bike borne assailants fired multiple times at two persons who were standing near an eatery. Both the victims died on the spot while a passer-by sustained bullet injury. One of the deceased, identified as Gyandev (37), was recently released on bail from prison. He was charged under IPC section 307 (attempt to murder). An FIR has been filed against Sanjeev Gupta, Sonu Gupta, Amrish Gupta, Manoj Gupta and Ankur Gupta. Sanjeev was held with murder weapon on Saturday and police is currently interrogating him. According to police, Gyandev was a resident of Jamalpur village of Roza. He allegedly had enmity with local resident Sanjeev Gupta. On Friday night, Gyandev was returning home with his friend Rizwan (32) after dinner when Gupta along with his aides targeted him in the city’s Khirnibagh locality. This incident occurred within a distance of 200 metres from a police picket under Sadar Bazar police station limits. When the police arrived, Rizwan and Gyandev were lying dead on the road while Shanu, who was passing by, sustained bullet injury. Police immediately sent Shanu for treatment at a district hospital. Shanu’s condition is said to be stable. Gyandev was earlier charged for attempting to kill Amrish’s father Siyaram. Gyandev’s brother Hari Om had alleged that the killing of his brother was an “act of revenge”. SHO Sadar Bazar police station Kiranpal Singh told TOI, “Two persons were shot dead in Khirnibagh locality and we have filed an FIR against five persons. We have arrested one of the accused and his interrogation is on.” In Sultanpur village of Katra block, a youth identified as Anuj Gangwar (22) was shot dead by his uncle Hetram Gangwar while his father Ramasre sustained bullet injury. The accused fled after the incident. Ramasre was admitted to a district hospital where his condition is stable. An FIR has been filed against Hetram and two other persons. Search is currently on. The deceased’s family staged a protest and blocked the national highway on Saturday. The protest was soon over after police assured them that the accused were in their custody. SHO Katra police station Vidyut Goyal told TOI, “The deceased had won a court case against his uncle over a property dispute recently which triggered the incident. We have filed an FIR against three persons and all of them are in our custody. We will produce them in front of remand magistrate on Sunday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Bareilly: Dreaded criminal and constable.description: BAREILLY: Wanted in several cases registered against him in Sambhal district, police arrested noted history-sheeter Sameer alias Shahroz aka Dulhe Miyan after a prolonged gun battle on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. One police constable also sustained bullet injuries during encounter. Both injured were taken hospital where doctors said that they were out of danger. During encounter, taking advantage of dark Sameer’s accomplice managed to flee the scene. Police kept continue combing operation to nab him but in vain. Police have lodged FIR in the matter. Police were on routine checking near Gavan village when they signaled motorbike borne two youths around 10 pm coming from Anupshahr side. Instead of following police directions, they accelerated the vehicle and ran towards Sambhal. Meanwhile, police alerted Hayatnagar police station and the cops had encircled them near Shakurpur village. Sooner, the miscreants opened fire on police party having found themselves encircled leaving a constable Kuldeep Kumar injured who sustained bullet injuries in his left arm. “In our defence we also opened fire and nabbed one accused while the other one was disappeared in cane fields. Sameer had been wanted in several cases lodged against him including cow slaughtering,” Superintendent of police, Yamuna Prasad said. The accused culprit also sustained bullet injuries in his leg. Police recovered a country made pistol, live cartridges and a motorbike from his possession. An FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) and Arms Act was lodged against Sameer and his absconding accomplice. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

39 BMC corporators \u2018resign\u2019 af.description: BAREILLY: After FIR against 28 BMC corporators - eight BJP corporators and 20 others - on June 15 for violating section 144 of Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), as many as 36 BJP councellors and three other members collectively resigned from their post on Monday. The corporators, who have been agitating for long, alleged that the FIRs were being lodged under fake cases and that they were not being heard even as they have been agitating for a fortnight. Following allegations of misconduct in official chores, Bareilly municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N had earlier lodged an FIR against a BJP corporator Vinod Saini. Fellow corporators since then have been staging protests on Nagar Nigam premises against the senior official. On Saturday, the agitators had burned effigy of municipal commissioner and had submitted a fresh memorandum at mayor’s office threatening to intensify the stir. BJP corporator Vinod Saini said, “It has been over two weeks that we are agitating against the fake allegations of corruption imposed on me by Bareilly municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N. The official has accused me of misconduct in BMC’s portable shop project and the move is simply to defame me. I and fellow BMC corporators had strongly condemned his action of FIR against me and had demanded the official to tender public apology and take back the fake case. However, the official is adamant and has again lodged a fresh FIR against 28 of us on June 15 under section 144 of CrPC.” Saini added, “I have been serving my duty in Bareilly Nagar Nigam for several years and never came across any such thing. Since we are not heard yet, 39 corporators - 36 from BJP and three others - have put forward their resignation.” Speaking to TOI, municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N said, “Section 144 of CrPC was imposed in BMC earlier following repeated councellors’ agitations on Nigam premises after I lodged an FIR against corporator Vinod Saini. Since I was being stopped from not entering my office and performing my duties, I had to lodge a fresh FIR against the agitators. However, the corporators repeatedly violated the law and intensified the stir.” On the “collective” resignation, Paul N said, “Now, they have tendered a collective resignation and the same is invalid as firstly, a corporator must give an individual resignation and cannot offer collective resignation, and secondly, the resignation must be addressed to the mayor. However, the councellors, who claim to have ‘resigned’, did not address it to Mayor Umesh Gautam, and thus, it is again invalid.” “The corporators are well aware that unless they address their resignation to mayor who is authorized, it is considered as invalid,” the municipal commissioner said, adding, “The move is clearly an eyewash.” Paul further said, “The councellors had made these agitations a new norm in BMC and as this was affecting my work I took legal action and after a while, managed to enter my office on Monday with the help of police force.” Though BJP corporators maintained that they had officially submitted their collective resignation to mayor and that he will be forwarding it to the state government, Bareilly mayor Umesh Gautam has refused to accept any resignation from the corporators so far. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shahjahanpur: Man held for trying to kil.description: SHAHJAHANPUR: A man has been arrested and booked for allegedly attempting to kill his wife after she refused to return home with him in Khuthar area of Shahjahanpur district on Monday. According to police, Pinki Devi, 28, was married to Ram Kumar, a resident of Gangsara village, two years ago and the couple has an one-year-old daughter. According to Pinki, Kumar often used to beat her and forced her to leave his house three months ago. “On Sunday, Kumar visited Pinki at her parental house in Prasadpur village and forced her to come with him along with their daughter. When she refused, Kumar tried to slit her throat with a knife, but she managed to escape with an injury on her neck. Later, Pinki lodged an FIR against Kumar,” said police. Khuthar SHO Sanjay Singh told TOI, “There is an injury on the victim’s neck and there were eye witnesses in the case as well. The accused was booked under IPC’s section 307 (attempt to murder).” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

CMO seals two illegal path labs in Pilib.description: PILIBHIT: Conducting routine checking drive of illegal medical practices in Pilibhit district, chief medical officer Dr Seema Agarwal on Monday sealed two pathology centres that were being run in violation to the medical rules in Puranpur town. The offenders had been asked to produce their documents and copies of permission to operate the path labs, if the owners failed to produce valid documents, stern punitive action would be taken against them, said CMO. CMO told TOI that the pathology centres were being run under the name Dr Dinesh Pathology and Migra Pathology without any qualified pathologist or an MBBS doctor. Both the centres were being operated by BAMS (Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicines and Surgery) qualified doctors, CMO said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Boy, 14, dies after speeding bus hits bi.description: BAREILLY: A 14-year-old boy died on Friday after a private bus hit his bike which was stationed at Manauta-Saidnagali road near Shahpur Sirpuda village. According to police, the speeding bus dragged the motorbike and the boy up to 20 metres before the driver applied breaks. The driver later fled the scene and the boy died on the spot. After the incident, scores of villagers gathered there and blocked the traffic movement, which was restored after three hours post the intervention of area circle officer Chandausi Poonam Mishra and sub-divisional magistrate Dipendra Yadav. The officials promised to take action and sent the body for post-motem examination. The deceased has been identified as Arun, a resident of Amroha. SHO Asmauli Rakesh Kumar said an FIR has been filed under sections 304 (culpable homicide) and 337 (rash driving) of the IPC against the unidentified bus driver and his bus has been seized. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven people die in two separate acciden.description: BAREILLY: As many as 7 people died in two separate accidents on Friday in Bareilly district. The first accident took place in Fatehganj east area where the car of food inspector Kapil Dev Rishipal crashed into a tractor trailer coming from the opposite direction. Rishipal and his driver Prem Shankar sustained critical injuries and were rushed to a private hospital where the doctor declared both of them brought dead. Rishipal was a resident of Bareilly and was posted in Roza area of Shahjahanpur district. He was on his way to Shahjahanpur. The second accident took place in Aliganj area where five persons died and three injured when a pick-up van rammed into a tempo coming from opposite direction. Unfortunately, a couple, identified as Suraj and his wife Shreevati, also came in contact with the crashed vehicles while riding a bi-cycle, leading to the death of Shreevati. According to police, both the vehicles were over-speeding. They all were rushed to district hospital in Bareilly by police where two of them succumbed to injuries. The bodies were sent for autopsy and their families have been informed. Apart from Shreevati (30) the decased in the Aliganj accident were identified as Kunwar Pal (26), Mamta Devi (28), her nephew Keshav (5). The survivors undergoing treatment at the district hospital were identified as Suraj Kumar (32) and Ajay Kumar (16). Additional SP (rural) Sansaar Singh said, “Seven people were killed in the rural areas in two accidents. We have registered FIR in both the cases against the driver under IPC sections 379 (rash driving) and 304 a (causing death by negligence). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

No helmet, no petrol: Bikers get three d.description: PILIBHIT: District magistrate Vaibhav Shrivastav on Friday extended by three days the enforcement of his order of not refuelling bikes of the riders without a helmet. On Friday, a delegation of petroleum dealers’ association met DM and sought extension in the enforcement of his order so that bikers could be sensitised about the newly-imposed safety measure. The DM’s order was scheduled to be enforced from June 14 with the objective of protecting the bikers from fatal accidents. According to assistant regional transport officer Amitabh Rai, “We, sub-divisional magistrates of all five tehsil circles and I, have been checking petrol pumps since morning hours for the compliance of the safety order. The district has nearly 2.4 lakh vehicle, including commercial, agricultural and private passenger vehicles, of which bikes accounted for a major part with 1.9 lakh.” After we found bikers without helmets were getting refuelled at many petrol pumps, fine was imposed on 36 bikers. When we sought pump owners’ response over refuelling of offenders’ bikes, they said ‘the bikers in general were not aware of the DM’s order’,” Rai said. Asked about petrol pumps management’s apprehension about illicit practice of providing helmets at a nominal rent to bikers without helmet for refuelling, Rai said this could hamper the prime objective of the order. “This situation will be tackled stringently,” he added. According to district president, petroleum dealers’ association, Alok Goel, the district has a total of 91 petrol pumps and all have been directed to display the new order prominently. But, at the same time, he feared the refusal to refuelling bikes of offenders could lead to a volatile situation. Rai said police would provide security guards to all major petrol pumps for their safety. ARTO, however, said bikers ferrying patients or facing some emergency situation would be exempted from the order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Sambhal municipal chairperson\u2019s son.description: BAREILLY: Sambhal municipality chairperson Arifa Shaqil’s son Hasnain has been booked for allegedly brandishing a pistol and threatening to kill former chairperson Nusrat Ilahi’s cousin Salman after the later posted pictures of garbage piles on social media and accused Shaqil for city’s ugly look. In his police complaint, Salman stated that he was on his way home around 9pm in Saraitarin locality under jurisdiction of Hayatnagar police station when Hanain and his two accomplices, who were travelling in a car, waylaid his motorbike. “He held me at gunpoint and abused me, and threatened me of dire consequences if I ever complain or post any message on social media against his mother and municipality officials,” said Salman. As locals came out of their houses hearing my screams, seeing them, Hasnain and his accomplices fled the scene, added Salman. Station house officer (SHO) Hayatnagar police station Ranveer Singh said, “An FIR has been registered against Hasnain and two others, and we are probing the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

After kin oppose marriage, couple commit.description: BAREILLY: A 20-year-old boy and 19-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide after consuming poison as their families were opposed to their relationship. The incident happened at Thura Bela village under Banda police station of Shahjahanpur at about 2 am on Thursday. According to Harpal Singh, station officer, Banda police station, “Both boy and girl belonged to same caste but their families opposed their relationship as they did not want them to marry them in the same village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.” According to police, Ajaypal alias Sachin (22) and Mamta (20) were in a relationship for the past two years. They wanted to marry each other but their families were opposed to their marriage. The two left their homes around midnight and met in a field near a canal. Police said after consuming poison around 2 am, they called their respective family members to inform them about the extreme step. Their families rushed to the spot and took them to the community health centre, but doctors declared them dead on arrival. Kali Charan, youth’s father, said, “After I got a call from my son, I called up Dial 100 team and informed them. We took them to the CHC but failed to save them. The girl’s family had objected to their marriage.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven blocks on Bareilly-Badaun border w.description: BAREILLY: Most of the malaria cases being reported since January, have been detected in three blocks of Bareilly and four blocks of Badaun on either side of the Bareilly-Badaun border, according to officials of the health department here. The cases are on the rise, they added. According to data available with the health department, 2,418 cases of plasmodium vivax (PV) malaria and 244 cases of “deadly” plasmodium falciparum (PF) malaria were detected from January to May in Bareilly district. Of these, 1,972 cases of PV and 130 cases of PF were reported only in May. Similarly, 941 cases of PV and 17 of PF occurred from January to May in Badaun. Out of total cases, 649 cases of PV and two cases of PF were detected in May in Badaun. PF malaria, which is considered as rare in the region, can be fatal if treatment is delayed beyond 24 hours after the onset of clinical symptoms, said officials. However, PV malaria is one of the common variants of the disease and is usually reported in the region. According to officials, cases of malaria are being reported from across Bareilly and Badaun but a majority of the patients who have tested positive hail from Majhgavan, Bhamora and Ramnagar blocks of Bareilly and Dataganj, Samrer, Jagat and Binawar blocks of Badaun. Both Bareilly and Badaun had reported outbreak of malaria last year and health experts said the number of cases are expected to go up during monsoon. Bareilly district malaria officer D R Singh said, “As the maximum temperature is hovering around 40 degrees centigrade, most of the waterlogged pits have dried up due to intense heat. It has affected breeding of mosquitoes and reduced their density. We are utilizing this time by screening more patients and giving them immediate treatment. If malaria parasite is removed from the bodies of locals, there will be less possibility of the disease from spreading in monsoon when mosquito breeding will be at its peak.” Badaun district malaria officer Vinod Kumar Sharma said, “We are conducting indoor residual spray at 173 sensitive villages of the four affected blocks of district. Our teams are holding health camps in villages for diagnosis and treatment of people. Besides, district magistrate has ordered the panchayati raj department and village heads to ensure cleanliness to contain mosquito breeding.” Indoor residual spray is also underway in Bareilly’s 218 sensitive villages. Officials said the specialty of indoor residual spray with DDT is that if a mosquito sits on a wall, it dies. The spray is effective for 75 days. Trench dug to contain sub-surface fire i.description: BAREILLY: Forest department and district administration on Saturday dug up a trench with the help of JCB machines in the forest area of Mohammadi range in Lakhimpur Kheri district to contain the sub-surface fire raging there. The officials claimed that they had managed to control the sub-surface fire and would douse it soon. They said there was no threat to wildlife, flora or people living in the nearby villagers. On Friday, villagers spotted smoke billowing out of the ground in the forest land near Belpahada village under Mohammadi block. When they rushed to the spot, they saw cracks in the soil and flames beneath it were clearly visible. The ground was hot. Forest department officials were called and they identified the phenomenon as sub-surface fire. Sub-surface fires are of low intensity, consuming organic matter beneath and surface litter of forest floor, including plant roots, humus and peat. This fire spreads very slowly and in most cases, it becomes very hard to detect and control such type of fires. They may continue to burn for months and destroy vegetative cover of the soil. On Saturday, JCB machines were deployed in the area to dig up a trench on the ground where the fire was visible. After digging over two feet, a layer of sand was visible. After this discovery, officials were assured that the underground fire had not been very intense and could be doused by showering water on it. Divisional forest official, South Kheri forest division, Samir Kumar monitored the operation and remained in the forest for several hours. He assured villagers of the nearby villages that the fire was not a threat to them. He told TOI, “The fire had not spread deep inside the forest area like it happens in areas around coal mines. We will be able to douse it completely soon. Soil experts have also paid a visit to the forest area and the situation is under our control." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23.
