AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BMC corporators intensify protest agains.description: BAREILLY: Corporators of Bareilly Municipal Corporation (BMC), who have been agitating for long against the allegations of corruption leveled against fellow councellor Vinod Saini by municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N, on Saturday intensified their protest and burned effigy of the official. According to the information from BMC, 44 BJP councellors and even some from Samajwadi Party (SP), Congress, Independents and others joined the agitation and submitted a memorandum to Bareilly mayor Umesh Gautam. Corporators said that they want municipal commissioner to take back his FIR and tender an apology. BJP corporator Vinod Saini said, “Bareilly municipal commissioner has put up allegations of corruption against me and has accused me of doing misconduct in portable shop project. The allegations are simply to defame me and to give a wrong message in public. Under BMC’s portable shop project, from making shop layout, giving contract, setting up sample shops in BMC premises to distribution of keys among vendors, everything has been done under guidance of senior officials in BMC. And yet, allegations of corruption have been made against me, unnecessarily. The senior official has lodged FIR against me under two-three sections. I have been serving my duty in Nagar Nigam for several years and never came across any such thing. I strongly condemn this action and want him to publically apologise.” Abdul Qayyum Khan, a SP corporator for four years from ward 69 (Koharapir), told TOI, “Municipal commissioner has lodged FIR against our mate Vinod Saini and has made allegations of corruption which is not true. We have submitted a memorandum to the mayor informing that development works in BMC will only be resumed after municipal commissioner takes back his complaint and publically apologise for his behaviour and defaming of our colleague. We will intensify the agitation and stage dharna at Nagar Nigam entrance and will not let any official enter the premises from Monday onwards.” Corporators alleged that they had submitted a memorandum at municipal commissioner’s office on June 1 regarding the same demands but nothing happened. Besides, with councellors protesting, development works - including cleaning of drains, maintenance of roads and other important works to be conducted ahead of monsoon - are put on hold. “Now, we have submitted a fresh memorandum to mayor and have informed that if our demand is not met, we will stage protest at BMC entrance and ensure that no official enters the premises from Monday. Official chores will only be resumed after we are heard,” added Khan. Bareilly municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N had earlier lodged an FIR against Saini following a heated argument between the two, according to information from BMC. The FIR has been lodged under section 406 (punishment for criminal breach of trust) and section 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) of IPC. When TOI contacted municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N, he was unavailable for comment. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BDA comes up with a \u2018rider\u2019 to.description: Bareilly: In order to attract people to book houses made under the Pradhan Mantri Awasya Yojana-Urban (PMAY-U) at Ramganga Nagar, the Bareilly Development Authority (BDA) announced free bus service for prospective buyers seeking to visit the site. The three-day service that began on Wednesday saw a ridership of 100 people, officials said on Friday. Under the PMAY initiative, the government aims to provide affordable housing for urban poor with a target of building 20 million houses by March 31, 2022. According to officials, only 300 people have got registered for residential flats after paying the registration fee while many have not turned up to pay the installment amount. At present, around 400 flats have been completed while the construction of more flats is underway. However, the BDA officials said the affordable houses constructed at Ramganfa Nagar has not found many takers due to its distance from the city. The BDA is currently accepting registrations at the special camps organised at its office and the last date of registration is June 15. People can avail free bus service to visit the site till the last day of the camp, said officials. Speaking to TOI, BDA secretery AK Singh said, “Many have availed the bus service which was launched by BDA to facilitate people and provide them a view of the houses. The move is aimed at providing conveyance to people interested and willing to buy the houses. As the Ramganga Nagar Awasya Yojana is located on the outskirts of the city, many people feel reluctant to visit the site and due to this, the residential scheme hasn’t been popular among the public. Thus, to give it a boost, we have been providing free trip for the people.” He added, “With last date of the registeration approaching, the number of people visiting the camp has risen. Around 100 people were taken to visit the site through the special bus over the last two days. Since the location is far from the city limits, only one ride is possible. We may increase the trip based on the requirement on the final day.” BDA officials hope that the move will help in quick booking of the houses under the scheme. Ram Singh, a resident of Sindhu Nagar said, “The residential plots are located on the outskirts. It is around 20 km far from my house. I have just learnt that tomorrow is the last day to avail of the bus service. I will try to visit the site and hopefully will book a house.” Under PMAY, the cost of a finished flat is Rs 4 lakh, but the flats are available for Rs 2 lakh, as a subsidy of Rs 1.5 lakh is being provided by the Centre and the remaining Rs 1 lakh by the state government. Thus, a beneficiary needs to pay the remaining amount of Rs 1.75 lakh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two killed in group clash in Uttar Prade.description: SHAHJAHANPUR: Two persons were killed and another was injured when two groups clashed over some dispute in Shahjahanpur district of Uttar Pradesh, police said on Saturday. Gyandev (35) and Rizvan (32) were killed in the clash near Bismil park here on Friday night, Superintendent of Police (City) Dinesh Tripathi said. The clash was between followers of Gyandev and Sonu Gupta. Gupta opened fire killing the two on the spot, the police said. The injured, identified as Shanu, has been admitted to a hospital, where his condition was stated to be stable. Gupta has been arrested, the police added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Pilibhit: Boy, 17, buried alive under mo.description: PILIBHIT: A 17-year-old boy, Niket, of Dandia Bhagat village under Barkhera police station was buried alive under a mound earth that caved in when he and his three friends were digging earth to repair their houses before the onset of monsoon. The boy was rushed to the community health centre in Barkhera, where he succumbed to his injuries. Police have sent the body for autopsy. Station house officer (SHO) of Barkhera police station Manoj Mishra said although the incident took place on Sunday morning, the family informed police late in the evening after the death of the boy. “The information has been registered in the police record.” Asked about the ex gratia to the victim’s family, Bisalpur circle sub-divisional magistrate Saurabh Dubey said, “We will examine the financial status of the victim’s parents, and then the ex gratia amount will be decided.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Inspector suspended after rape victim ha.description: BAREILLY: A day after a 24-year-old rape victim allegedly hanged herself in a village under Dataganj police station of Badaun blaming police for inaction, senior superintendent of police (SSP) Ashok Kumar Tripathi on Monday suspended station house officer of Dataganj police station for “carelessness”. He has appointed Govind Singh as SHO in his place. Tripathi said, “I have suspended inspector Amrit Lal with immediate effect for carelessness in lodging an FIR in the matter. The woman in her suicide note had claimed that the inspector made her father return without registering FIR. I have transferred the probe to SP (city) in the matter. The accused are relatives of the woman.” The married woman alleged in her suicide note, “I am ending my life on my free will as when we go to a police station, nobody hears us. The SHO made my father return as he did not want to lodge an FIR. If you want money for registering an FIR, tell me. I am leaving this world. I am hopeful that the SP will ensure justice in my case.” She also wrote, “I love my husband who has left me since the three accused destroyed my life.” The victim had said she was married two years ago and had been living with her parents in Badaun since February as her health deteriorated. “On May 15, when I was on my way home after visiting a doctor, one of my relatives met me at a bus stand and told me that my husband was not well and I must come with him to see my husband. Two people were accompanying the relative. Believing them, I sat in his car but they forcefully took me to Secundrabad in Telengana and confined me to a house. They raped me for a week and took away all my jewellery and mobile phone.” After police at Dataganj police station had failed to lodged an FIR, the victim had approached senior police officers. An FIR was lodged in the matter against three persons on Sunday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Blaming cops of inaction, rape survi.description: BAREILLY: Blaming police of inaction, a 24-year-old rape survivor, who had been running from pillar to post to get a case registered, allegedly committed suicide in a village under Dataganj police station area of Badaun district on Sunday. In her suicide note, the woman, who hung herself to death, blamed the police for the extreme step. The victim stated that she was married two years ago and had been living with her parents since February, after her health deteriorated. “On May 15, when I was on my way home after visiting a doctor, one of my relatives met me at a bus stand and told me that my husband was not well and I must come with him to see my husband. Two people were already accompanying the relative. Believing them, I sat in his car, but they forcefully took me to Secunderabad in Telangana and confined me to a house,” the woman stated in her suicide note. “They raped me for a week and snatched all my jewellery and mobile phone, leaving me helpless. I could not even contact my family. One day, when they were taking me to Delhi in a train, I called my father using the mobile phone of a co-passenger and gave him Delhi’s address where they were taking me,” the suicide note further stated. The victim also stated that it was her father who made her free from the clutches of her tormentors and took her home in Badaun. The victim had alleged that she had given written complaints to Dataganj police station SHO, Badaun SSP and Bareilly zone ADG, but none of them paid heed to her plight. “I love my husband a lot. Since I was raped, my husband left me. I am left with no other option, except ending my life,” she concluded in the note. SSP Ashok Kumar Tripathi told TOI, “When she approached Dataganj police, they advised her to lodge an FIR in Secunderabad as the crime was committed there. Then the woman met ADG on June 12, following which we were instructed to lodge an FIR. After probing into the matter, we booked the three accused.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Girl, 3, dies of illness, kin blame quac.description: PILIBHIT: After a three-year-old girl, who was reportedly suffering from pneumonia, died in Neuria town on Monday night, her family members blamed it on the quack who had allegedly administered oral nasal drops to her before her death. Following the order of district magistrate Vaibhav Shrivastav, chief medical officer Dr Seema Agarwal and drug inspector Babita Rani rushed to the spot and took stock of the matter. Meanwhile, the quack’s clinic was sealed and he had been given 48 hours to produce his valid medical degrees before the CMO. Neuria police station SHO Shahroz Anwar said, “The girl’s father had taken her to the quack, Shivpad Vishwas, in a nearby village on Monday night. After Vishwas administered a few nasal drops to the girl, her condition started deteriorating and she died within one and a half hours at her home.” Police was informed in the midnight, but both sides settled the matter by the morning, Anwar said. However, an FIR would be lodged in connection with illegal medical practice after the chief medical officer reached a conclusion that Vishwas was a quack, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shahjahanpur DM orders action against ab.description: SHAHJAHANPUR: During a random inspection at the district hospital here, Shahjahanpur district magistrate found chief medical superintendent (CMS) of women’s district hospital missing from duty and empty beer bottles in the hospital premises. DM said he will write to the state government to take action against the CMS and ordered that action be taken against the cleanliness agency. District magistrate Amrit Tripathi paid a surprise visit to the district hospital on Monday. While inspecting the women hospital, he found its chief medical superintendent missing from her desk. Later, it turned out that she was on leave without permission. Tripathi immediately recommend disciplinary action against her. While inspecting the wards, the water tank and other parts of the hospital, the DM found several irregularities, including empty beer bottles. After this discovery, Tripathi ordered action against the contractor responsible for cleanliness of the hospital and recommended cancellation of his contract. Tripathi told TOI, “Cleanliness in a hospital is an extremely important aspect of health service and no compromise is acceptable on this issue. This is why I have recommended strict action against the contractor.” Earlier, the DM ran a drive in the city to ensure that all the bikers be made aware about the importance of donning helmets while driving. A few bikers were also made to walk a distance of 500 metres as penalty for disobeying traffic rules. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

No helmet, no petrol: DM conducts drive,.description: PILIBHIT: With the ‘no helmet, no petrol’ drive in progress, district magistrate Vaibhav Shrivastav, along with officers of transport and police departments, conducted a drive to check compliance of the order by petrol pump owners at different city locations on Monday. The DM was accompanied by superintendent of police Manoj Kumar Sonkar, assistant regional transport officer (ARTO) Amitabh Rai, Pilibhit Sadar sub-divisional magistrate Vandana Trivedi, and civil and traffic police. Meanwhile, after a group of lawyers reportedly created ruckus at a petrol pump owned by petroleum dealers’ association president Alok Goel, he ordered refuelling of bikes of the riders without a helmet. “The administration has assured us of providing security, but nothing was done. We don’t want to be abused or assaulted,” said Goel. The DM, however, appealed to petrol pump owners to comply with the order strictly. “The compliance of order by the bikers will take some time, but the desired result will start emerging in a couple of days as we are motivating them to follow the order and also taking stern legal action against the offenders. The order will remain in effect,” said the DM. Asked about deployment of security at petrol pumps, he said needful would be done within a day or two. Rai, meanwhile, said more than 300 bikers without a helmet were fined on Monday and they issued challans amounting cumulatively to the tunes of Rs 3 lakh. “Stickers bearing message ‘mujhe apne parivar ki chinta nahi hai isliye mai helmet nahi lagaata’ (I am not worried about my family, therefore, I do not wear a helmet) were put on bikes of the riders without a helmet by the DM and SP,” said ARTO. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Five killed, eight injured in tempo-.description: BAREILLY: Five persons, including two women and a 5-year-old child, were killed and eight others injured when a pick-up truck collided with a tempo near here. The accident took place in Khailam village under Aliganj police station, police said on Friday. The injured have been admitted to the district hospital, where the condition of two of them is said to be critical, they added. UP irrigation \mMinister Dharampal Singh rushed to the district hospital on getting the information about the accident. "The driver of the pick-up truck has been arrested, said Superintendent of Police (Rural) Sansar Singh. He identified deceased as Shriwati (45), Krishnapal (30), Mamta (27) and Mamta's son Keshav (5). The identity of the fifth deceased is yet to be ascertained, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Road safety awareness week kick-starts i.description: BAREILLY: Aiming to check road accidents due to flouting of traffic rules by motorists, Bareilly traffic police department on Monday kick-started a road safety week during which they would sensitise local commuters about the importance of following traffic rules for their safety. Besides, traffic police has also chalked out a seven-day enforcement plan during which motorists will be checked for flouting traffic rules such as overloading of public transport vehicles, overspeeding, riding without a helmet or seatbelt, triple-riding, drunk driving, wrong aide driving, jumping red light, etc. Meanwhile, at a special workshop organised in collaboration with the Bareilly Regional Transport Office (RTO), auto and tempo drivers and others were sensitised about traffic rules, and pamphlets displaying various traffic rules were also distributed among them. Speaking to TOI, superintendent of police (traffic) Subhash Chandra Gangwar said, “During the drive, motorists, including drivers of public transport vehicles such as auto-rickshaws, e-rickshaws, tempo drivers and drivers of roadways buses, will be checked for traffic rules, and legal action will be initiated if anyone is caught breaking traffic rules.” The SP added, “Motorists will also be checked for driving licence and other important documents concerning their vehicles, and parking in ‘no-parking’ zones.” Traffic police department officials said besides these, special programmes would also be organised for the locals and drivers of public transports to make them understand the importance of following various traffic rules for their safety and for the safety of other motorists. Bareilly traffic police had recently organised a workshop for public transport drivers at Police Lines, where they were sensitised about traffic rules. Besides, a special programme was also conducted, where drivers of auto-rickshaws and e-rickshaws took a pledge to obey traffic rules and regulations. Notice served on four people, hospital a.description: BAREILLY: At a time when health authorities are making all-out efforts to contain rising malaria cases in Bareilly district, the threat of dengue also looms large over the city. The health department has served notice to four people and a private hospital after finding larvae of Aedes mosquitos in their premises. Aedes mosquito causes dengue. Officials said they will start a drive against private hospitals in Rampur Garden to check if Aedes larvae are present or not. However, so far, no positive case of dengue has been reported this year but officials said the vertor–borne dengue will spread during monsoon. Last year, a few private hospitals had reported suspected dengue cases but officials here confirmed that only two patients tested positive. According to health officials, when a team conducted random inspections, it found larvae of Aedes mosquito in the premises of four people residing in quarters near Shyamatganj flyover. The team also found larvae in a private hospital situated on Stadium road. D R Singh, district malaria officer, said, “We have served notice to people on whose house or hospital larvae was found. They have been asked to maintain cleanliness. Our team will again inspect these places after a week. If they are again found flouting rules, we will ask Bareilly Municipal Corporation to impose a fine on them.” Meanwhile, the health department has been conducting a survey on density of mosquito pre-monsoon and post-monsoon in several parts of the district to ascertain which areas are more prone to vector-borne diseases. During the survey, no mosquitoes were found at Ghatpuri village under Binawar block of Badaun and Jagat community health centre of Badaun. Officials said the density of mosquitoes will go up after the rains. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SP workers submit memorandum on increasi.description: BAREILLY: Following their party chief Akhilesh Yadav’s instructions, scores of Samajwadi Party workers on Saturday gathered at Damodar park here and marched to the collectorate and submitted a five-point memorandum, addressed to the President, to city magistrate Sanjay Singh. SP’s former district unit secretary Haider Ali said over the past two weeks as many as 72 people were killed and 24 rape cases reported from different parts of the state. “We demanded from the President to sack the BJP government immediately and impose President rule as the law and order in UP has completely deteriorated,” he said. In the memorandum, SP workers demanded a compensation of Rs 1 crore for kin of slain UP Bar council president Darvesh Yadav, who was shot dead in a broad daylight. The agitated workers also raised the matter of police assault on journalists in the state. “Every day, at least one rape case of minor girl is reported in the state and police are sitting as mute and deaf,” said Haider. In the absence of DM at the collectorate, the agitating workers handed over the memorandum to the city magistrate. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

17-year-old held for raping 8-year-old g.description: BAREILLY: A 17-year-old boy was arrested on Thursday for allegedly raping an 8-year-old girl in a village under jurisdiction of Nawabganj police station in Bareilly. According to police, the incident took place on Wednesday when the minor girl had gone out to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. They said the accused took the girl to a secluded place and raped her. He later fled the spot after dropping the girl near to her house. Later, when the girl felt pain in her private parts and lower abdomen, she narrated her ordeal to her mother after which a case was filed. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said, “We had gone through CCTV camera footage that was installed at a nearby college which is close to the place where the incident took place. During investigation, we detained two persons and called the girl to identify the accused. After he was identified, we took the juvenile into the custody. During interrogation, the accused confessed to his crime.” Station house officer of Nawabganj, inspector Rajesh Kumar Singh, said that after producing the accused in the court, he was sent to the juvenile centre on Friday. SHO Rajesh Kumar Singh added, “The accused juvenile, was previously in a juvenile home for raping a girl in 2017. He was released seven months ago.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Underground fire in Uttar Pradesh forest.description: LAKHIMPUR KHERI: An underground fire in Mohammadi range forests of Uttar Pradesh left scores of neighbouring villagers panicked and puzzled. Smoke was seen gushing out through the cracks in the ground and at some places land had turned into embers, said residents of Bela Pahara and Muda Galib villages in South Kheri forest division. 72-year-old Hukum Singh of Muda Galib said he has never been witness to such a scene. He feared that the fire may damage his crops. Another villager, Bhai Lal (75), termed the scene as a natural miracle, which he had never heard of or seen earlier. Some villagers also mistook it as a volcanic incident. Soon after the incident was reported, officials rushed to the spot. "The incident is a natural phenomenon in which fire broke out in underground humus layer," Vikas Dubey, Tehsildar of Mohammadi, told PTI. "The land where the underground fire incident took place has been lying barren for several decades and dry leaves, twigs and branches from nearby jungles accumulated there and formed the underground humus layer," he said. He also spoke to local villagers who said that a few days back, they had burnt fire on the land. He said "the overground fire was put out but it unknowingly caught the humus layers which resulted in smoke emission from the cracks". Divisional Forest Officer of South Kheri, Sameer Kumar, said, "Forest officials were rushed to dig up trenches around the affected land to prevent its spread of the fire to the nearby forest." Terming it 'swamp pit fire', field director Dudhwa Ramesh Kumar Pandey said, "Swampy lands often develop underground holes in which organic matters accumulated and scorching heat sometimes result in such underground fire." Public transport drivers take oath to ob.description: Bareilly: Bareilly traffic police department recently organized a special workshop for public transport drivers at Police Lines here on Saturday. The drivers were sensitized about traffic rules. A special programme was conducted wherein drivers of auto rickshaws and e-rickshaws took a pledge to obey various traffic regulations including driving within speed limits, not overloading their vehicles and driving under the influence of alcohol.Speaking with TOI, superintendent of police (traffic) Subhash Gangwar said, “A special workshop was organized here to make drivers of public transport aware of the need for following traffic rules and regulations. The special workshop was attended by around 200 public transport drivers, including drivers of e-rickshaws auto-rickshaws, tempos and roadways buses. Apart from apprising them about traffic norms, drivers were also made to pledge that they would obey traffic rules.” The SP added, “Drivers were asked to adhere to traffic rules such as not halting vehicles randomly on the road, picking or dropping passengers from at least 50 metres from main junctions or trisections, not parking vehicles in a manner that free traffic movement is hampered, not ferrying passengers above the actual limit of the vehicle, not speeding and driving under the influence of alcohol.” Meanwhile, a number of traffic violators were issued challans for flouting traffic rules . A sum of Rs 1,15,000 was recovered as fine from the violators.According to traffic police officials, traffic rule violation has become rampant in the city with drivers of both public and private vehicles indulging in various offenses including speeding, overloading, not carrying a valid driving licence, jumping signals, illegal parking and wrong side driving. To keep a check on rampant violation of rules, random enforcement drives are also being launched in the city. Soon, drives will be launched against erring three-wheeler drivers, having rural permits, but operating within city limits. Legal action will be initiated against such drivers, said the officials. Last month, Bareilly traffic police had issued challans to as many as 110 public transport drivers in a span of two days for causing jams near prominent junctions and roads during one such drive.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man learns about daughter\u2019s affair,.description: BAREILLY: After learning about his 15-year-old daughter’s affair with a cousin, a man allegedly tried to stab her to death. He was helped by his son. Assuming that she was dead, the father-son duo dumped her at Pasgawa village on Friday night. However, passersby saw the injured girl lying near the state highway and informed police. The girl was immediately rushed to the district hospital in Shahjahanpur. After undergoing treatment, the girl’s condition improved and she regained consciousness on Saturday. In a statement to police, the girl said she was a resident of Roza area and in a relationship with the son of her aunt. However, her father was against their match and had fixed her marriage elsewhere. When she refused to marry the man chosen by her father, he along with her elder brother allegedly strangled her and stabbed her with a knife. After recording her statement, police have filed an FIR against her father and brother under IPC section 307 (attempt to murder). Both are on the run. The injured girl is being taken care of by her elder sister and aunt in hospital. Additional SP (city) Dinesh Tripathi also visited the hospital and spoke with the girl. He said, “The girl was found in an unconscious condition with multiple injures. She was treated at the district hospital, where her condition is stable. She has alleged that her father and brother attempted to kill her. We are investigating the case.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. 8 trains to be cancelled for 15 days on.description: BAREILLY: As many as eight trains, including Intercity Express, will remain cancelled for 15 days from June 25 onwards due to ongoing track repairs on the Lucknow-Delhi route. Chief traffic manager’s office released an order to this effect on Monday evening. The order said track number 2 of Moradabad division will be replaced. Those trains that will remain cancelled from June 25 are Intercity (14315/16), Padmavat (14207/08), Faizabad-Delhi Express (14305/06), Varanasi-Doon Janata Express (14265/66), Jansadharan (13257/58), Aligarh passenger (54351/52) and Bareilly-Moradabad passenger (54311/12). In addition, the Varanasi-Bareilly Exprerss (14235/35) will not run between Shahjahanpur and Bareilly. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

12-year-old falls into oil tank, critica.description: BAREILLY: A 12-year-old boy slipped into a boiling oil tank and sustained 99% burn injuries in Gokul Nagla village of Kalaan area of Shahjahanpur district on Tuesday morning. The boy was playing near an open mentha oil unit and accidentally fell into hot oil tank. He was immediately brought out of the tank and rushed to the community health centre where doctors referred him to the district hospital. The victim, Rajkumar, was playing with his friends on the roadside when he suddenly slipped and fell into the open oil tank which was boiling at a high temperature. The labours working at the unit immediately took him out of the tank and informed his father about the accident. Rajkumar was admitted to the district hospital in Shahjahanpur. According to sources, his chances of survival are slim as he was brought almost 2.5 hours after the incident as Kalaan is far away from the district hospital. The victim’s father, Ramveer, told TOI, “My son has sustained critical burn injuries after he accidentally fell into the oil tank. He is in excessive pain. I would request action against the oil unit for showing negligence.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Village head\u2019s hubby killed by his.description: BAREILLY: The decapitated body of Sabir Khan, the husband of Rampura Maafi village head Ayesha Khan, who had been missing since Friday evening, was on Sunday found in forest area under jurisdiction of Bhojipura police station here. Police suspected that Faruq Khan, a resident of the same village, had killed Sabir as the latter had “illicit” relationship with the former’s sister. Sabir’s wife Ayesha had lodged a missing FIR at Bhojipura police station on Saturday. Sabir was a transporter, who had gone out in connection with his business on Friday, but did not return. After the FIR, police sought his mobile location and call detail records (CDRs), and later detained Faruq. According to police, during interrogation, Faruq purportedly accepted his crime. Station house officer (SHO) of Bhojipura police station Rajesh Kumar told TOI, “Faruq confessed that he shot dead Sabir and dumped his decapitated body in the forest area.” Meanwhile, police are trying to identify other persons who helped Faruq in the murder and also gathering evidence. SHO said, “We have arrested Faruq in this connection and trying to identify if anyone else was involved in the murder. We will share further details after collecting evidence.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five hurt in LPG lantern blast.description: BAREILLY: At least five women sustained burn injuries in LPG lantern explosion in Sambhal district’s Pali village under jurisdiction of Asmauli police station on Friday evening. The women were sitting in the veranda of one Kuldeep Kumar’s home when the lantern exploded. Three of the injured have been referred to higher medical facility in critical condition. The injured women have been identified as Kuldeep’s wife Pushpa, his mother Sheela, and three sisters-in-law Babita, Beena and Nirvesh. Upon hearing explosion, neighbours came running to the spot and informed the emergency ambulance services 108. Station house officer (SHO) of Asmauli police station Rakesh Kumar said all injured were shifted to hospital, where doctors referred Pushpa, Babita and Beena to higher medical facility with 70% burn injuries. “Three women in serious condition have been referred to a higher medical facility in Moradabad, while the remaining two are said to be out of danger,” said SHO. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. UP: Girl stabbed by father, brother for.description: SHAHJAHANPUR: A 15-year-old girl was stabbed and thrown into a canal by her father and brother for refusing to marry a boy of their choice, police said on Monday. The girl suffered injuries in the stomach and face but managed to swim to a nearby village and told the locals about her ordeal who then informed the police and got her admitted to the district hospital here, SP City Dinesh Tripathi said. The incident took place on Friday on Asmani bridge in Lakhimpur area, police said, adding that the girl's father and brother have been arrested. According to police, the victim, who is undergoing treatment, wanted to marry her cousin but her parents had fixed her wedding elsewhere. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Medical services hit as private doctors.description: BAREILLY/ PILIBHIT: Medical services were affected in private hospitals after nearly 650 doctors under the aegis of Indian Medical Association (IMA) in Bareilly went on a one-day strike on Monday. As these doctors boycotted OPD (out-patient department), many patients were forced to return home after they were denied treatment. The strike was called in support of the demand to provide safe working environment to doctors in the wake of the attack on Dr Paribha Mukharjee at NRS Medical College in Kolkata by a mob. By evening, there were indications that the medics would call off their strike after having met Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. However no formal announcement was made for calling off the doctors’ strike. But throughout Monday, patients had to bear the brunt of protest after doctors stayed away from OPD in private hospitals, nursing homes, clinics and private medical colleges in Bareilly. Most of the hospitals wore a deserted look throughout the day. Sanjay Mishra, who lives near Choupla, said, “My eight-year-old son has high fever and I took him to a hospital in Rampur Garden but no doctor was available due to the strike. I later purchased general medicines from a medical shop. I will visit the hospital on Tuesday for correct treatment.” A homemaker, Vineeta Katheriya who lives in the Subhash Nagar, said, “I have been having a backache since Sunday night and it aggravated on Monday. As I was aware about the doctors’ strike, I stayed at home and will consult a doctor on Tuesday.” Though private doctors shut OPD services, there was no significant increase in footfall of patients at government hospitals. Chief medical superintendent of district hospital, Dr KS Gupta, said, “In comparison to June 10 (last Monday), there was rise of nearly 200 patients on June 17. As private doctors catered to patients in the emergency, there was no impact of their strike in our hospital.” Dr Raghvendra Sharma, vice-president of IMA’s Bareilly unit, said, “We attended critical patients and those admitted to the emergency ward. We took out a march from IMA building to Chowki crossing and sent a memorandum to Prime Minister Narendra Modi through Bareilly district magistrate for enacting a law for providing a safe working environment to doctors.” The protesting doctors in Bareilly also burnt an effigy of Kolkata chief minister Mamata Banerjee. In Pilibhit, private doctors observed a day-long strike but attended to emergency cases. They took out a protest march in Pilibhit city by donning helmets. Apart from 55 IMA doctors, 65 doctors under the aegis of National Integrated Medical Association (NIMA) also joined the strike on Monday. District general secretary of IMA, Pilibhit, Dr Deepak Kumar Gangwar, said they would be compelled to resort to stern measures if the government did not pay heed to their demand for setting up a three-member committee to ensure the safety of doctors and to enforce action against miscreants in case of any violence at their medical establishments. CO who stopped Mohammad Azam Khan from d.description: RAMPUR: City circle officer Ashutosh Tiwari, who had stopped Samajwadi Party MP-elect Mohammad Azam Khan from delivering a speech in Rampur Fort after his election to the Lok Sabha, was attached with the office of the DGP in Lucknow on Thursday. Speaking with TOI, Rampur, superintendent of police Ajay Pal Sharma said, “City circle officer Ashutosh Tiwari has been attached with the DGP office in Lucknow.” The official letter, however, did not mention reason for the transfer, he added. Azam Khan along with his supporters had staged a protest against the police officers after he was stopped from delivering a speech, thanking his voters. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Flight to Bareilly misses deadline, offi.description: BAREILLY: After Jet Airways, the airline which had won the bid to operate 70-seater commercial aircraft from Bareilly, grounded all its aeroplanes, a new player, Trustar, managed to bag a fresh bid in April and announced that it would start commercial operations from June 15, but in vain — the deadline was missed again. Airport Authority of India (AAI) officials, on the other hand, appeared clueless when asked about the commencement of flights from the city. Interestingly, Union minister and local MP Santosh Gangwar had inaugurated the airport in a haste hours before the imposition of the model code of conduct for the Lok Sabha elections on March 10. In April, a team of Turbo Aviation Pvt Ltd had visited the newly-built airport and after taking stock of arrangements, Turbo’s manager, operations, PV Ravi Shankar said the aviation firm would start flight operations from here on June 15. Shankar had told TOI that they had obtained the permission from the civil aviation department of the UP government as well as the Airport Authority of India (AAI) to start operation of flights under regional connectivity scheme for six destination from Lucknow in UP. In the first phase, they had planned daily flights to Bareilly, Prayagraj, Varanasi and Agra. Except Bareilly, all the three airports are operational. “Our flights will operate under the brand name ‘Trustar’,” he said. Well-placed sources with the civil aviation department in Lucknow said Trustar would be able to procure a 70-seater passenger carrier in the first week of June only, and that was the reason why it missed the deadline. Bareilly airport director SK Singh, however, said, “The airline has procured an aircraft and that they are in the process of seeking clearances from various departments. Besides, our airport is ready for a flight anytime. We hope that in the first or second week of July, they will start booking tickets for Lucknow flight.” Notably, Trustar will operate flights only for Lucknow and not to Delhi.
