More than 15,000 tourists visit PTR sinc.description: PILIBHIT: Eco-tourism season came to an end on Saturday as Pilibhit Tiger Reserve (PTR) closed for the monsoon. The reserve will reopen on November 15. The season that opened from November 15, 2018 to June 15, 2019, saw an increase in both footfall as well as revenue as against the previous season. Although the current year’s eco-tourism marked an increase in overall revenue and footfall in comparison to the previous season, it fell short of the figures registered in 2016-17, when the jungle tourism was under the direct command and control of PTR administration. The management of jungle tourism is now in the hands of UP Forest Corporation. The revenue earned through jungle tourism has been transferred by the PTR administration to the account of UP Forest Corporation. The current season’s figures reveal that Chuka was visited by as many as 15,885 Indian and 23 foreign tourists generating a total revenue of over Rs 36 lakh. The huts at Chuka were booked by 209 tourists for night stay, the highest figure so far. In the 2017-18 season, 14,885 tourists visited PTR generating a revenue of over Rs 32 lakh. In comparison to this, in 2016-17, PTR saw 16,360 footfall and maximum-ever revenue to the tune of over Rs 37 lakh. Asked why PTR could not match the 2016-17 figures, reserve’s deputy director Adarsh Kumar said that this could be an outcome of sharp hike in entry fee and rates of huts at Chuka. Asked why a tiger foundation had not been set up in PTR as in other reserves, Kumar said the proposal had been sent to the state forest administration on February 17 , 2016 for approval and is still pending. Once the tiger foundation is set up, all eco-tourism revenue will be deposited with it and PTR can use the funds on its own. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP govt doctors wear black band in solid.description: Lucknow: Government doctors across Uttar Pradesh on Friday wore black bands to express solidarity with their counterparts protesting violence against two of their colleagues in West Bengal. The step was taken in response to a call for a four-day nationwide protest by Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Friday. Dr Amit Singh, general secretary of Provincial Medical Services Association, UP, said, “Government doctors wore black bands while discharging their duties at various hospitals in the state. In the afternoon, a delegation of the doctors submitted a memorandum addressed to the Prime Minister through the district magistrate." In the memorandum, “We have demanded security for doctors so that they do not feel scared” while discharging their duties. He added that more than 18,700 doctors who are members of the Provincial Medical Services Association, UP took part in the protest. Junior doctors in West Bengal are on a strike since Tuesday after two of their colleagues were attacked by a mob and seriously injured at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata following the death of a 75-year-old patient who died of a cardiac arrest. The incident raised concerns regarding security of doctors. In Meerut, doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association, wore helmets and black badges in protest and demanded proper security for doctors so that they can work properly. “We condemn the incident and it is just sad that doctors who save people’s lives are being attacked. We need a safe and secure environment to function, or else we will not be able to admit any serious patients. This is because if there is a high probability of death of a person, the chances are that his family will be annoyed and might attack us,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Meerut Indian Medical Association (IMA) unit. As a mark of protest, doctors in Meerut wore helmets and black badges while they tended to their patients on Friday. “If our demands of providing adequate security to doctors are not met, then the doctors will go on strike. However, due to the protest, only common man suffers,” said Dr Jain, who condemned the incident and demanded strict action against the perpetrators of this heinous crime. Dr Raghvendra Sharma, vice-president of IMA's Bareilly unit, said “More than 25 doctors gathered on Friday and donned black ribbons on their arm. We have sent a mail to the Prime Minister's Office to condemn the Kolkata incident." In Pilibhit, a delegation of doctors associated with the IMA demanded constitution of a district-level committee comprising a senior police officer not below the rank of additional superintendent of police, the chief medical officer and a designated delegate of IMA to ensure safe working environment for medical professionals. The delegation was called for empowering this committee to review all cases of violence against doctors and enforce prompt legal action against the assailants. The delegation handed over a memorandum of demands to additional district magistrate, (finance and revenue), Atul Singh, which was addressed to the Prime Minister. “We have demanded a new legislation from the Prime Minister to protect doctors and their medical establishments from violence as everyone in the country has the right to work in a safe environment,” said Dr Deepak Kumar Gangwar, district general secretary of IMA in Pilibhit. OP Yadav, IMA secretary for Agra district said, “In solidarity with our colleagues in West Bengal, doctors wore a black ribbon on their arm and gathered at the district collectorate to handover a memorandum to the district magistrate and senior superintendent of police. They demanded adequate arrangement for strict implementation of the UP Medical Protection Act. Violence in hospitals adversely affects patient care and institutions will be reluctant to take up complicated and risky patients which will affect critical care. A national law against violence in hospitals has to be brought in urgently that should provide a minimum of seven years of imprisonment for hospital violence.” (With inputs from Ishita Bhatia from Meerut, Priyangi Agarwal from Bareilly, Keshav Agrawal from Pilibhit and Deepak Lavania from Agra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. Two minors raped in west UP districts.description: BAREILLY: In yet another case of crime against minor in western UP, an eight-year-old girl was raped by a youth in a village under the Nawabganj police station on Wednesday when the girl was going to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. While in Shahjahanpur district, a 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two youths after breaking into her house in a village under Khutara police station limits. The crime is said to have occurred on June 7, but police allegedly didn’t lodge any complaint turning her parents away when they reached the police station. The FIR was only lodged after the girl’s parents met the superintendent of police S Chinnapa on Thursday and he instructed the station house officer to do so. In the case under the Nawabganj police station, the accused man, who came on a bicycle, told her that her father was calling her to the field and took her to a secluded place where he allegedly raped her and fled after dropping her near the house. Police have lodged an FIR and are conducting raids to nab the accused. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said that the rape survivor’s father and uncle had gone to the field leaving her at home with her mother. She remained silent and narrated her ordeal to her mother in the evening only after she started having pain in her private parts and lower abdomen. “The accused was caught in a college CCTV camera while carrying the girl on a bicycle. We have scanned the CCTV camera footage. His face was not clear,” the SP said. The SP added that they had set up three teams to nab the accused. “Since the girl didn’t object while going with the accused on his bicycle, it seems that he was from the same village and known to her. The girl has been sent for medical examination. An FIR has been lodged under section 376 and POCSO Act,” the SP said. In Shahjahanpur district, the survivor’s father, in his police complaint, stated that her daughter was alone at home when two youths – Vikram and Nikku – barged into their house in the evening. They were carrying a sword and a country-made pistol. Threatening the girl both of them took turns to rape her. Both the accused fled the scene after the arrival of the girl’s parents. They even threatened to kill the parents if they complained against them. The SP said that an FIR under section 376 D (gang rape) of IPC and POCSO Act had been lodged. They were conducting raids to nab the accused. SHO Sanjay Singh said, “We had received the complaint and lodged FIR after investigation. The girl has been sent for medical examination and raids are on to arrest both the accused.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four held for sodomizing 13-year-old.description: BAREILLY: All the four accused who were booked for allegedly sodomizing a 13-year-old have been arrested by Shahjahanpur police. An FIR has been lodged against Mohammed Rehman, Ravi, Gulli and Wasim under IPC section 377 (unnatural offences). While one of the accused was nabbed on Sunday, the other three were arrested on Monday night and sent to Shahjahanpur district jail on Tuesday. According to police the accused knew the boy. Giving details about the incident, SHO, Powayan police station, Jasvir Singh said, “On Saturday evening, the accused offered the boy a cold drink and asked him to come along with them. They took him to a mango orchard and allegedly sodomized him. The accused fled from the spot after the boy lost consciousness. Late in the night, he regained consciousness and somehow managed to return home. After he narrated his ordeal to his parents, they approached us and an FIR was filed against the accused. We have now arrested all the four and sent them to jail. “The boy was taken to hospital for treatment and medical examination. He was later discharged and his condition is stable. The medical report has confirmed sodomy and we will soon file a chargesheet against the accused,”said Jasvir Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The BJP's surprise pick — Om Birla — is all set to become the next Lok Sabha Speaker after his candidature on Tuesday was backed by all NDA allies as also by the YSR Congress Party, the Biju Janata Dal and key opposition parties, including the Congress. A notice was given to the Lok Sabha Secretariat by the BJP, proposing the name of Birla, a two-time MP from Kota-Bundi seat in Rajasthan, for the Speaker's post and bringing a motion for his election, which will be held on Wednesday. As per sources, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 57-year-old Birla's name for the post. The Rajasthan leader is considered to be close to both Modi and BJP president Amit Shah. 10 parties extend support to Om Birla's candidature for Lok Sabha speaker: Prahlad JoshiBirla's surprise nomination is seen by many in the BJP as a message from the top leadership that the party will promote leaders who keep a low-profile and work at the ground-level. BJD, YSRCP, JDU, Shiv Sena, Akali Dal, National People's Party, Mizo National Front, Lok Janshakti Party, AIADMK and Apna Dal have given the notice to support Birla's candidature for the Speaker's post, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters. Later, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the party and the UPA allies have also decided to support the candidature of Birla as the Speaker. Chowdhury also said the Congress has already moved a motion supporting the ruling party candidate. The decision to support Birla's nomination was taken at a meeting of the UPA allies, where the leaders also discussed the opposition strategy during Parliament session. Birla won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was re-elected from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. He defeated Congress's Ramnaraian Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently concluded general election. He has also been elected to Rajasthan assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. Birla will succeed eight-term MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this will not be for the first time a relative newcomer will hold the position. In 1996, TDP leader G M C Balayogi was also a two-time MP when he was elected as the LS Speaker and after his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and the first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Sub-surface fire rages in Kheri forest a.description: Bareilly: After news of smoke billowing out of the ground in the forest land near Belpahada village of Mohammadi block in Lakhimpur Kheri district spread, locals started gathering in the area on Friday. Soon a team of forest and administrative officials visited the spot and found that the smoke was a result of sub-surface fire. Sub-surface fires are of low intensity, consuming organic matter beneath and surface litter of forest floor, including plant roots, humus and peat. This fire spreads very slowly and in most of the cases, it becomes very hard to detect and control such type of fires. They may continue to burn for months and destroy vegetative cover of the soil. There are four revenue villages in the radius of two kilometers from the forest land. This has sparked fears that if not controlled, the sub-surface fire will consume forest wealth, affect wildlife and people living in the vicinity. According to local villagers, they observed smoke in Jamuniaghat beat of Mohammadi forest area, spanning 25 acres. There were cracks in the soil and flames beneath the soil were clearly visible. The ground was hot. Bur forest department assured villagers that necessary action would be taken to douse the sub-surface fire at the earliest. Divisional forest officer, South Kheri forest division, Samir Kumar informed his superiors about the fire so that steps can be taken for preventing any damage to forest and human habitat. Mohammadi forest range is a social forest region but has carnivores and herbivores along with rich flora. Tehsildar Vikas Dhar Dube, who also visited the village with his team, said, “We are inspecting the area to identify if such signs are visible elsewhere.” Kumar told TOI, “This could be an extremely dangerous situation as we are not aware about the total area where the underground fire has spread. We are planning to dig a large pit using JCB machines to douse the underground fire. However, it will be done after seeking permission from seniors and receiving expert advice. Our priority is to ensure safety of flora and fauna of the forest and that of local people. As of now, we have advised locals to stay away from the area.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Uttar Pradesh: 217 cartons of illicit li.description: BAREILLY: Launching a crackdown on liquor mafia, police on Sunday seized as many as 217 cartons of illicit liquor in Sambhal and arrested an accused. According to police, the estimated cost of the seized Haryana-made liquor is around Rs 2 lakh, the sale of which is prohibited in Uttar Pradesh. The arrested man has been identified as Shyamraj Singh. Chandausi circle officer Poonam Mishra said after receiving a tip-off that truck container carrying illicit liquor in huge quantity would pass through Chandausi, police had taken position near Majhavali crossing in Behjoi. “We have seized 217 cartons of Haryana-made illicit liquor, the cost of which is around Rs 2 lakh. An FIR under relevant sections of the Excise Act was registered,” said CO. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12.
